item.title: 【UPSCALED】Tycho - See (Performance Cut) [4K AI Upscale | HEVC 10-bit | PCM]
item.description:
Genre: Electronic
Style: Downtempo, Ambient
Year: 2014
Video Source: Vimeo, WebMaster
Audio Source: Qobuz

"See" is a song by American musician, record producer, composer, and songwriter Scott Hansen (born February 7, 1977), known professionally as Tycho. It's the fifth track on his third studio album Awake, released in 2014. His music blends multiple stylistic components, including downtempo guitar, analogue synthesis, and ambient elements such as breathing and found sounds of weather broadcasts and dialogue.
Months after the release it was remixed into a bubbling pop song by New York duo Beacon. 2017 brought the next phase, as Beacon’s Thomas Mullarney III joined Tycho at Coachella to perform "See" (the first time the band has ever featured a vocalist).

The music video of this release is not the default one. This one only features the performance of the band, presented through methods of infrared photography. They captured the thousands of scattered, IR-visible dots emitted by an array of Xbox 360 Kinect Sensors, only 'seen' through the Infrared camera, and supplemented the patterns with laser projections that bathe the image with fill light and color.

Release Info
The video track is upscaled from 1080p to 4K with Topaz Video AI and encoded to HEVC 10-bit.
The PCM track is lossless, downloaded from Qobuz and synced with Adobe Audition.
